meanings.definition: To urge or incite someone to attack or pursue someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The angry mob sicced their dogs on the intruder.
meanings.sent2: The police officer sicced the K-9 unit on the suspect.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat sicced the toy mouse on its unsuspecting owner.
meanings.sent4: The coach sicced his team of players like a pack of wolves on the opposing team.
meanings.sent5: The villain sicced his henchmen on the hero, creating chaos in the city.

meanings.definition: To order or command someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher sicced the students to clean up the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The boss sicced the employees to finish the project by the end of the day.
meanings.sent3: The parent sicced the kids to tidy up their rooms before bedtime.
meanings.sent4: The sergeant sicced the soldiers to advance towards the enemy's position.
meanings.sent5: The director sicced the actors to rehearse the scene until it was perfect.
